intro: Chisocheton gjellerupii, commonly known as the Gjellerup's chisocheton, is a rare tropical tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers with five petals. It produces woody capsules containing numerous seeds, typical of many species in its family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
